description:
## Practice on [SHACL validator action](https://github.com/helio-ecosystem/helio-action-shacl-validator) part I ### Given the [lcc dataset](https://github.com/helio-ecosystem/helio-ecosystem/blob/main/resources/siotrx/actions/shacl/lcc-dataset.ttl) define a SHACL shape that contains a `sh:NodeShape` for each class in the dataset, specify the class from the dataset to which the node shape applies using the property `sh:targetClass`. Then, print the shape and check it with the **expected results**

Note that the first thing to look up are the classes that the dataset has. To this end, the [SPARQL engine action can be used](https://github.com/helio-ecosystem/helio-action-sparql-engine).
user_template:
<#-- RDF data --> 
<#assign shape>
@prefix schema: <http://schema.org/> .
@prefix sh: <http://www.w3.org/ns/shacl#> .
@prefix ex: <http://shacl-practice.helio/resource/>.


ex:SampleShape a sh:NodeShape ; 
  <#-- Add here the target class to which the shape applies --> .

</#assign>
[=shape]
solution_template:
<#-- RDF data --> 
<#assign shape>
@prefix schema: <http://schema.org/> .
@prefix sh: <http://www.w3.org/ns/shacl#> .
@prefix ex: <http://shacl-practice.helio/resource/>.

ex:CivicStructureShape 
  a sh:NodeShape ; 
  sh:targetClass schema:CivicStructure .

ex:MuseumShape 
  a sh:NodeShape ; 
  sh:targetClass schema:Museum .

ex:UniversityShape 
  a sh:NodeShape ; 
  sh:targetClass schema:CollegeOrUniversity .
</#assign>
[=shape]
